Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_open_filter

The function AIL_open_filter opens a filter to prepare it for use.

HDRIVERSTATE AIL_open_filter(
  HPROVIDER lib,
  HDIGDRIVER dig
);

In Parameters

lib
specifies the filter to open.
dig
specifies the digital driver handle to use.

Returns

A handle to the now opened filter, or NULL if the open failed.

Discussion

You aren't required to open a filter before using it, but some filters may need to allocate memory or do other CPU-intensive processing when first opened. Calling AIL_open_filter ahead of time allows you to schedule the possible CPU hit.

This function call is optional - if you call AIL_set_sample_processor on an unopened filter, then the filter will be automatically opened.

Open filters are cleaned-up automatically at driver shutdown time, so it is only necessary to explicitly close a filter if you wish to reclaim resources consumed by a filter than you no longer intend to use.

Example files that use this function: Filter.CPP


Group: Digital Filter Services
Related Functions: AIL_close_filter, AIL_enumerate_filters, AIL_open_filter, AIL_set_sample_processor
Related Basic Types: HDIGDRIVER, HDRIVERSTATE, HPROVIDER
